snippet: The arrests come just one day after a referendum on a draft Constitution and follow months of harsh crackdowns on opposition politicians and civic groups ahead of a presidential election.
abstract: Zimbabwean security officials arrest three senior officials of the Movement for Democratic Change, country's main opposition political party, and renowned human rights lawyer Beatrice Mtetwa, one day after largely peaceful referendum on draft constitution.
lead_paragraph: The arrests come just one day after a referendum on a draft Constitution and follow months of harsh crackdowns on opposition politicians and civic groups ahead of a presidential election.

headline.main: Zimbabwe Arrests Opposition Officials and a Human Rights Lawyer
headline.print_headline: Zimbabwe Arrests Opposition Officials and a Human Rights Lawyer
